titleStmt.title: Von Ludwig Wittgenstein an Bertrand Russell, 26. 12. 1912
titleStmt.author: Wittgenstein, Ludwig

sourceDesc.p: Original in The Bertrand Russell Archives der McMaster University; Kopie im BA. Publiziert (Letters, S. 17; deutsch: Briefe, S. 23f.; Cambridge Letters, S. 21; WiC, S. 36).

div.p: On arriving here I found my father very ill. There is no hope that he may recover. These circumstances have ‒ I am affraid ‒ rather lamed my thoughts & I am muddled allthough I struggle against it. I had a long discussion with Frege about our Theory of Symbolism of which I think, he roughly understood the generall outline. He said he would think the matter over. The complex-problem is now clearer to me & I hope very much that I may solve it. I wish I knew how you are & what sort of time you are having, & all about you!
